title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — On a night where the final score was almost a footnote, Glen Rice authored a masterpiece for the Charlotte Coliseum faithful, pouring in a career-high 40 points to single-handedly will the Hornets to a thrilling 99-97 victory over the Washington Bullets.

From the opening tip, Rice was a man possessed, a flamethrower in a No. 41 jersey. The Bullets had no answer for his silky-smooth jumper, which found the bottom of the net from every conceivable angle on the floor. He was the engine of the Hornets' offense, a one-man scoring barrage that Washington could only watch, helpless, as the points piled up.

While Rice’s historic output provided the fireworks, the game hung in the balance until the final second. Washington, led by a valiant 23 points from Chris Webber and 19 from Tracy Murray, refused to wilt. The two teams traded blows in a tense fourth quarter, the outcome uncertain until the final horn sounded.

But this night belonged to Rice. In a career filled with accolades, his 40-point eruption stands as a singular, dominant performance. He didn't just score; he carried his team, ensuring that every time the Bullets threatened to seize momentum, he had an answer. When the last shot fell and the buzzer echoed, the stat line was undeniable: a historic 40 for Glen Rice, and a hard-fought win for the Hornets. It was a performance for the ages, and for one night in Charlotte, Glen Rice was unstoppable.
